content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, Given a struct `FloatWithUnits` with fields `value` and `unit` (make sure to define it!), write a `show` method for it that will concatenate the value and unit with a space like this "1.8 meters".

Here's how you can accomplish this in Julia:

```julia
struct FloatWithUnits{T<:Real}
    value::T
    unit::String
end

function Base.show(io::IO, f::FloatWithUnits)
    print(io, f.value, " ", f.unit)
end
```
This `show` method will take an I/O stream (like the standard output in Julia console) and a `FloatWithUnits` object as arguments. It then prints out the value of the FloatWithUnits object followed by a space and the unit. 

You can test this function with:
```julia
f = FloatWithUnits(1.8, "meters")
println(f) # Outputs: 1.8 meters
```
